comments: This turned out to be one of my favorite classes at Harvard! I didn't know anything at all about academia surrounding multiculturalism, and so I had very low expectations, but now realize that multiculturalism is THE contemporary issue facing Western / liberal democracies. The great thing about one-topic seminars is that you come out of it feeling like you really understand something from all angles. I feel like I really know this area of interest now; when I am reading literature on multiculturalism, I recognize so many cited authors and works, and it is a great feeling. You definitely need to put in the work for this class, but it's worth it. Paul is also a great facilitator and prober, so you feel challenged. And he ties in contemporary issues since it is all relevant. Each class, we read article headlines, watched documentary/TV clips, and looked at recent polls. Recommend with enthusiasm.
